newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore July CPI rises 1.3 percent on year.
newsitem.headline: Singapore July CPI rises 1.3 percent on year.

text.p: Singapore's July consumer price index (CPI) was up 1.3 percent from a year earlier and unchanged from June, the Department of Statistics said on Tuesday.
In June, the CPI rose 1.2 percent from a year earlier and 0.1 percent over May.
A Reuter poll of economists last week predicted the CPI would rise 1.4 percent year-on-year in July.

Note - In June year-on-year basis food rose by 0.6 percent, clothing fell by 2.2, housing rose by 0.1, transportation and communication fell by 0.5, education rose by 1.3, health was unchanged and miscellaneous fell by 0.5.
